DOC.brief_summary: Fatigue is a frequent and disabling symptom in patients with multiple sclerosis (MS). The pathophysiology of this sign is not fully understood. Some data suggest that the fatigue is associated with sleep disorders. The aim of this study is to determine the polysomnographic parameters in MS patients with fatigue in comparison to MS patients without fatigue.
DOC.brief_title: Sleep Disorders in Patients With Multiple Sclerosis
DOC.criteria: Patients with multiple sclerosis Expanded Disability Status Scale score < or = 5 Fatigue (Modified Fatigue Impact Scale > 45), with a disease duration > 3 months Depression Cognitive disorders EDSS > 5 Epilepsia Obesity Drug inducing sleep disorders
